required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: DCVAC/OvCa After Standard-of-care Chemotherapy in Women With Relapse of Platinum-sensitive Epithelial Ovarian Cancer
clinical_study.official_title: An Open-label, Single-group, Multi-center, Phase II Clinical Trial Evaluating the Effect of Maintenance DCVAC/OvCa After Standard-of-care Therapy in Women With First Relapse of Platinum-sensitive Epithelial Ovarian Cancer

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this trial is to investigate if maintenance DCVAC/OvCa after second-line chemotherapy of carboplatin/gemcitabine or carboplatin/paclitaxel improves efficacy outcomes in women with FIGO stage III and IV epithelial ovarian carcinoma who experienced relapse more than 6 months after complete remission of first line platinum-based chemotherapy (platinum sensitive ovarian cancer)

detailed_description.textblock:
All patients who fulfill all eligibility criteria will undergo a leukapheresis procedure. All eligible/enrolled patients will receive standard-of-care therapy with carboplatin/gemcitabine or carboplatin/paclitaxel starting 2 to 7 days after leukapheresis.
After 6 cycles of chemotherapy, patients will start maintenance treatment with DCVAC/OvCa.
Treatment will continue irrespective of tumor progression until completion, refusal, intolerance of treatment or death.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: open-label DCVAC/OvCa after treatment with carboplatin in combination with either gemcitabine or paclitaxel

primary_outcome.measure: Progression Free Survival by modifications to the RECIST 1.1
primary_outcome.time_frame: Assessed from enrollment up to 104 weeks
primary_outcome.description: PFS as defined as the time from the first dose of Standard-of-Care (SoC) therapy administerd until tumor progression or death from any cause

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Assessed from enrolment through study completion approximately 5 years
secondary_outcome.description: Defined as the time from first dose of SoC therapy administered until death due to any cause assessed until study completion

secondary_outcome.time_frame: CA-125 assessed every 6 weeks up to 104 weeks
secondary_outcome.description: Defined by increasing CA-125 levels per Gynecologic Cancer Intergroup (GCIG) criteria

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Response is assessed every 8 weeks up to 104 weeks
secondary_outcome.description: CR and PR measured by the modifed RECIST 1.1 criteria

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Blood samples collected 5 times throughout the study from enrolment up to 104 weeks
secondary_outcome.description: Detection of entire anti-tumor immune response int he serum

secondary_outcome.measure: Incidence of Treatment-emergent adverse events [safety and tolerability]
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Screening through 30 days after completion of treatment
secondary_outcome.description: Safety profile as determined by the nature, incidence, duration, severity and outcome of adverse events (AEs) including serious AEs (SAEs) as assessed by CTCAE v. 4.0

secondary_outcome.time_frame: CA-125 assessed every 6 weeks up to 104 weeks

secondary_outcome.measure: Time to either tumor or biologic Response
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From first dose of chemotherapy until either objective or serologic progression for up to 104 weeks.
secondary_outcome.description: Response according to RECIST or CA-125 measurements as increased to >2 times ULN

arm_group.description: Standard-of-care carboplatin/gemcitabine or carboplatin/paclitaxel followed by DCVAC/OvCa

intervention.description: activated dendritic cells (DCVAC/OvCa) for immune maintenance after chemotherapy
either carboplatin and gemcitabine or carboplatin and paclitaxel followed by DCVAC/OvCa

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients with histologically confirmed FIGO stage III or IV epithelial ovarian, primary peritoneal or fallopian tube carcinoma (serous,endometrioid, or mucinous) who had complete remission after first-line platinum-based chemotherapy
- Radiologically confirmed relapse after >6 months of remission ( platinum-sensitive cancer)
- Laboratory parameters per protocol
Exclusion Criteria:
- FIGO I, II epithelial ovarian cancer
- FIGO III, IV clear cells epithelial ovarian cancer
- Non-epithelial ovarian cancer
- Borderline tumors ( tumors of low malignant potential)
- Prior or current systemic anti-cancer therapy for ovarian cancer (chemotherapy, monoclonal antibody therapy, tyrosine kinase inhibitory therapy, vascular endothelial growth factor or hormonal therapy) except first-line Pt based chemotherapy ( with or without bevacizumab)
- fertile women of child-bearing potential not willing to use a highly effective method of contraception or a combination of methods
- Pregnant of lactating women
- Pre-defined co-morbidities
- Known hypersensitivity to any constituent of DCVAC/OVCa or the selected chemotherapy compounds
